qas.question: What is the total complement of genes in an organism or cell known as?
What does a chromosome consist of?

answers.text: a single, very long DNA helix

qas.question: What is encoded on a chromosome?
What is the region of the chromosome at which a particular gene is located called?

context: The total complement of genes in an organism or cell is known as <a0_0>its genome<a0_0/>, which may be stored on one or more chromosomes. A chromosome consists of <a1_0>a single, very long DNA helix<a1_0/> on which <a2_0>thousands of genes<a2_0/> are encoded.:4.2 The region of the chromosome at which a particular gene is located is called <a3_0>its locus<a3_0/>. Each locus contains <a4_0>one allele of a gene<a4_0/>; however, members of a population may have different alleles at the locus, each with a slightly different gene sequence.
